site.description: Official Website of Global Business Philanthropy Association

hero.slogan: Business for Philanthropy, Philanthropy for Business
hero.subtitle: Harnessing Business Power for Social Value
hero.name: Global Business Philanthropy Association

impact.title: Global Influence
impact.description: The business network of GBPA covers 12 Asian countries, with over 30,000 registered corporate members and more than 500,000 beneficiaries.

pillars.title: Core Pillars
pillars.description: GBPA builds a global ecosystem of business for good by facilitating cross-border industrial alliances and technological docking as the bridge of business cooperation, taking public welfare innovation of designing sustainable social impact models as its mission, and focusing on youth sustainable development for cultivating next-generation entrepreneurs and green economy as the future.

cooperation.title: Business Cooperation
cooperation.description: Facilitating Cross-border Industrial Alliances and Technological Docking

development.title: Youth Development
development.description: Cultivating Next-generation Entrepreneurs and Green Economy

items.description: GBPA facilitated GCash's cooperation with SoftBank Japan to upgrade cross-border payments, combining rural agent banking networks and financial education philanthropy, achieving 300% growth in cross-border payment users and being selected as a World Economic Forum inclusive finance case.

GBPA introduced Singapore's GIC investment to help Paytm expand into Southeast Asian markets, benefiting street vendors through zero-fee micro-loans and free QR code devices, and was recognized as an IMF digital financial inclusion benchmark.

GBPA jointly developed agricultural supply chain financial products with Mitsubishi UFJ Bank, prioritizing support for women's entrepreneurship through the women entrepreneurs network, achieving an ultra-low bad debt rate of 1.8% and gaining World Bank best practice recognition.

GBPA facilitated MoMo's joint establishment of the ASEAN cross-border payment alliance with Thailand's TrueMoney, launching interest-free loans for women's entrepreneurship and public welfare points redemption, with users exceeding 30 million covering one-third of Vietnam's population.

GBPA promoted cross-border cooperation between Grab and Indonesia's Gojek and connected multiple national merchants at the ASEAN Digital Summit, achieving a 25% increase in Southeast Asian market share through public welfare donations from food delivery orders.

GBPA assisted TrueMoney in cooperating with Ant Group to optimize cross-border remittances, promoted cashless payments in the Asian Financial Technology Alliance, and provided free POS machines for rural areas, with users exceeding 50 million accounting for 70% of Thailand's population.

GBPA facilitated Sea's cooperation with Tencent to optimize the Shopee payment system, connected multiple national sellers at the Southeast Asian e-commerce summit, and established an education fund donation mechanism, resulting in a 35% growth in e-commerce GMV.

GBPA promoted cooperation between KakaoPay and Alipay to expand the Chinese tourist market, promoted cross-border payments at the Asian Financial Technology Forum, and supported environmental protection projects, achieving a 200% growth in transaction volume among Chinese users.

news.title: Latest Updates
news.eventTitle: Preview of 2025 Asia Business Philanthropy Summit
news.eventDescription: The Global Business Philanthropy Association is about to hold the 2025 Asia Business Philanthropy Summit, an annual event bringing together Asia's top entrepreneurs, investment institutions, and philanthropy leaders. The summit will be themed 'Business for Good, Co-creating the Future,' focusing on three core topics: cross-border industrial cooperation, philanthropic innovation models, and youth green development.
news.eventThemeText: Business for Good, Co-creating the Future

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: Understanding the Mission and Vision of GBPA

introduction.title: Association Overview
introduction.description: The Global Business Philanthropy Association (GBPA) is an international non-profit organization headquartered in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Founded in 2010, it upholds the philosophy of 'Business for Philanthropy, Philanthropy for Business' to promote cross-border integration of business resources and public welfare causes.

positioning.title: Organization Positioning and Core Philosophy
positioning.position: Asia's leading cross-border non-profit platform for 'Business + Philanthropy'
positioning.coreIdea: Business for Philanthropy, Philanthropy for Business
positioning.vision: Building a sustainable closed loop of cross-border business and philanthropy, promoting the symbiotic cycle of corporate value and social responsibility

scale.title: Scale and Influence
scale.description: Covering 12 countries in Asia including China, Taiwan, Malaysia, Singapore, Japan, and Thailand, with over 30,000 entrepreneur members spanning 6 sectors including technology, finance, manufacturing, and healthcare. It has 120+ charity projects benefiting over 500,000 people.
scale.fieldsNote: Spanning 6 sectors including technology, finance, manufacturing, and healthcare

president.name: Chen Zhipeng
president.title: President
president.description: Expert in international trade and cross-border mergers and acquisitions, founder of 3 multinational enterprises, recipient of honors such as the 'Asia-Pacific Philanthropic Leadership Award' and 'Asian Social Innovation Pioneer'.

members.name: Lin Yahui
members.description: Yah-Huei Lin has 12 years of operational management experience in large non-profit organizations, having led the implementation of multiple cross-border charity projects. She excels in process optimization and team collaboration, driving efficient linkages among internal functions to ensure projects are completed on time and with high quality.

members.name: Zhang Kaiwen
members.description: Kevin Chang has a background in Big Four auditing and investment banking, familiar with financial statement preparation, budget control, and risk management. Since joining the association, he has established a transparent and compliant financial system, regularly publishing project fund flow and impact reports to strengthen donor trust.

members.name: Wang Jingyi
members.description: Ching-Yi Wang graduated from the London School of Economics and Political Science, having worked in market expansion teams of multiple multinational enterprises. She is skilled in identifying public-private partnership opportunities, having successfully促成 in-depth collaborations with over 20 enterprises and foundations, enhancing the association's social influence.

members.name: Liu Zefeng
members.position: Director of Public Relations and Communications
members.description: Tse-Feng Liu has experience in media and public relations, having planned national charity promotion activities. He is responsible for the association's brand building and public opinion management, guiding public attention to new models of business for good through multi-channel content dissemination.

members.name: He Junming
members.description: Chun-Ming Ho has regional network resources in Southeast Asia, long-term based in Thailand and Vietnam for business development. He coordinates the daily operations and liaison of 8 country branches, ensuring local projects comply with local laws, regulations, and cultural customs.

philanthropy.title: Charity Projects
philanthropy.subtitle: Philanthropy Promotes Business, Let Philanthropy Achieve Business Value
philanthropy.description: GBPA is committed to integrating business success with social responsibility, contributing to education, post-disaster reconstruction, agricultural development, and other fields in Asia through diversified charity projects.

firefly.name: Firefly Education Assistance Program
firefly.description: Focused on supporting poor students in remote Asian areas to complete their education, providing tuition fees, living expenses, and learning supplies through a 'one-on-one' sponsorship model. The project name implies 'shining lights converging to illuminate the future'.
achievements: Covered 6 countries including the Philippines, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Cambodia
features: Regular follow-ups to track academic progress

japan311.name: Japan 3.11 Post-Disaster Reconstruction Project
japan311.description: Responding to the post-disaster reconstruction needs of Japan's Tohoku region after the earthquake and tsunami, the association launched a special fundraising campaign, focusing on supporting community infrastructure reconstruction, psychological rehabilitation services, and industrial revival projects.
achievements: Supported over 500 families in rebuilding their homes
nextSteps: Complete construction of remaining 5 community centers

greenVillage.name: Green Village Agricultural Training
greenVillage.description: A sustainable agricultural training project launched for rural areas in Southeast Asia, helping farmers increase income and protect the ecological environment through the promotion of modern agricultural technologies and organic farming training.
achievements: Covered 3 countries: Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia
greenVillage.impact: After project implementation, participating farmers saw an average 40% increase in annual income, a 60% increase in organic agricultural product sales, and significant improvement in soil quality.
partners: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

digitalFinance.name: Digital Financial Education
digitalFinance.description: To enhance the digital financial literacy of people in Asia, the association organized professional teams to carry out education and training on digital payment, network security, financial planning, and other themes in 5 countries.
digitalFinance.impact: Among the project's covered population, digital payment usage increased by 70%, financial fraud victimization decreased by 50%, and personal financial literacy significantly improved.

joinUs.description: The Global Business Philanthropy Association (GBPA) cordially invites like-minded enterprises, organizations, and individuals to join our global network, jointly promoting the deep integration of business and philanthropy to create sustainable social value.
